comment.author: 102881146@N07
comment._content: How wonderful to see two of Bill Mathew’s images of Bungarribee house.  Bill won prizes for photos submitted,  including some of Bungarribee/Eastern Creek.  The close-up of the tower from March 1957,  helps date surviving colour slides from his various trips to the old homestead.  Within two months,  the house was demolished.  The distant shot (from south) was part of a collection used in the architectural study of 1950,  by tech students J. R. Kell,  M. P. Kitson,  W. M. Mathews,  J. W. Newman and C. V. Sylvester-Booth.  JWSM

comment.author: 69269002@N04
comment._content: Hi bungarribee, thanks for your comments. It's great to be able to share these images, especially with people like yourself who can provide further information. We'll be posting more images very soon.

comment.author: 102881146@N07
comment._content: Because Bill’s negatives haven't survived (just a quantity of his colour slides),  finding a good quality print is a rarity.  The above is an unknown shot.  Details contained,  means that other images from 1956-7 can be placed in date order.  Bill was possibly reconstructing a similar pose from May 1950, which should also appear in the Kodak collection (with James Kell in frame).  John WSM
